title: Coconut oil
summary: Coconut oil (or coconut butter) is an edible oil derived from the wick, meat, and milk of the coconut palm fruit.[1] Coconut oil is a white solid fat, melting at warmer room temperatures of around 25 °C (78 °F), in warmer climates during the summer months it is a clear thin liquid oil. Unrefined varieties have a distinct coconut aroma.[2] It is used as a food oil, and in industrial applications for cosmetics and detergent production.[1][2] Due to its high levels of saturated fat, numerous health authorities recommend limiting its consumption as a food.[2][3]
